description.zh-cn: 苏格兰哲学家、经济学家，被誉为“经济学之父”或“资本主义之父”。其著作《国富论》是现代经济学的奠基之作。
description.en: A Scottish philosopher and economist, hailed as the 'Father of Economics' or the 'Father of Capitalism'. His work 'The Wealth of Nations' is a foundational text of modern economics.

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰的一所公立研究型大学，亚当·斯密曾在此求学并担任教授。
description.en: A public research university in Scotland where Adam Smith studied and later became a professor.

nodes.id: 牛津大学贝利奥尔学院

zh-cn: 牛津大学贝利奥尔学院

description.zh-cn: 牛津大学的组成学院之一，亚当·斯密曾在此获得斯内尔奖学金进行学习。
description.en: One of the constituent colleges of the University of Oxford, where Adam Smith studied on a Snell Exhibition.

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰启蒙运动时期的哲学家、经济学家和历史学家，亚当·斯密的挚友。
description.en: A Scottish Enlightenment philosopher, economist, and historian, and a close friend of Adam Smith.

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰哲学家，亚当·斯密在格拉斯哥大学的老师，对斯密影响深远。
description.en: A Scottish philosopher who was Adam Smith's professor at the University of Glasgow and had a profound influence on him.

nodes.id: 国民财富的性质和原因的研究

zh-cn: 国民财富的性质和原因的研究
en: An Inquiry into the Nature and Causes of the Wealth of Nations

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密的代表作，系统性地阐述了古典经济学理论，奠定了现代经济学的基础。书中提出了劳动分工、自由市场和“看不见的手”等核心概念。
description.en: Adam Smith's magnum opus, which systematically expounds classical economic theory and lays the foundation for modern economics. It introduces core concepts such as the division of labour, the free market, and the 'invisible hand'.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密的第一本主要著作，阐述了他的道德哲学，核心是基于“同情心”的理论。
description.en: Adam Smith's first major work, which lays out his moral philosophy based on the principle of 'sympathy'.

description.zh-cn: 一种经济理论和政策体系，主张通过贸易保护主义（如减少进口、增加出口）来积累国家财富。亚当·斯密的《国富论》对其进行了经典的批驳。
description.en: An economic theory and policy system that advocates for accumulating national wealth through protectionist trade policies (such as reducing imports and increasing exports). It was classically refuted by Adam Smith in 'The Wealth of Nations'.

description.zh-cn: 18世纪法国的经济学派，认为国家财富的唯一来源是农业。其领导人物是弗朗索瓦·魁奈。
description.en: An 18th-century French school of economics that held that the wealth of nations was derived solely from the value of agriculture. Its leader was François Quesnay.

description.zh-cn: 以亚当·斯密的《国富论》为起点的经济学派，主要关注经济增长和财富分配。
description.en: The school of economic thought that began with Adam Smith's 'The Wealth of Nations', focusing primarily on economic growth and wealth distribution.

description.zh-cn: 英国政治家，聘请亚当·斯密担任其继子亨利·斯科特的私人家教。
description.en: A British politician who hired Adam Smith as a private tutor for his stepson, Henry Scott.

nodes.id: 第三代巴克卢公爵亨利·斯科特

zh-cn: 第三代巴克卢公爵亨利·斯科特

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰贵族，亚当·斯密在1764年至1766年间担任其私人家教。
description.en: A Scottish nobleman for whom Adam Smith served as a private tutor from 1764 to 1766.

description.zh-cn: 法国经济学家，重农主义学派的领导人，亚当·斯密在巴黎与其结识并极为尊重其理论。
description.en: A French economist and leader of the Physiocratic school, whom Adam Smith met in Paris and whose theories he greatly respected.

description.zh-cn: 法国启蒙时代的思想家、作家、哲学家。亚当·斯密在日内瓦与其会面。
description.en: A French Enlightenment writer, historian, and philosopher. Adam Smith met with him in Geneva.

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰法夫郡的一个城镇，是亚当·斯密的出生地。
description.en: A town in Fife, Scotland, which is the birthplace of Adam Smith.

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰医生和化学家，亚当·斯密在格拉斯哥大学的同事和好友，也是斯密的遗嘱执行人之一。
description.en: A Scottish physician and chemist, a colleague and friend of Adam Smith at the University of Glasgow, and one of the executors of Smith's will.

description.zh-cn: 苏格兰地质学家，亚当·斯密的好友，也是斯密的遗嘱执行人之一。
description.en: A Scottish geologist, a friend of Adam Smith, and one of the executors of Smith's will.

description.zh-cn: 大卫·休谟的哲学著作，因其对基督宗教的批判性内容而具有争议。休谟曾请求亚当·斯密在他身后出版此书，但斯密拒绝了。
description.en: A philosophical work by David Hume, controversial for its critical content regarding Christianity. Hume asked Adam Smith to publish it posthumously, but Smith refused.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密为纪念其挚友大卫·休谟而写的悼词。因赞扬被视为无神论者的休谟，该文为斯密招致了大量批评。
description.en: A eulogy written by Adam Smith in memory of his close friend David Hume. The letter brought considerable criticism upon Smith for praising Hume, who was widely regarded as an atheist.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密于14岁进入格拉斯哥大学学习道德哲学。
description.en: Adam Smith entered the University of Glasgow at the age of 14 to study moral philosophy.

relationships.target: 牛津大学贝利奥尔学院

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密获得斯内尔奖学金进入牛津大学贝利奥尔学院学习。
description.en: Adam Smith studied at Balliol College, Oxford, with the Snell Exhibition scholarship.

position.zh-cn: 逻辑学教授；道德哲学教授
position.en: Professor of Logic; Professor of Moral Philosophy

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密于1751年被任命为格拉斯哥大学的逻辑学教授，次年改任道德哲学教授，直至1764年辞职。
description.en: Adam Smith was appointed Professor of Logic at the University of Glasgow in 1751, and became Professor of Moral Philosophy the following year, a position he held until his resignation in 1764.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密与大卫·休谟在爱丁堡讲座期间相识，并成为终身挚友。
description.en: Adam Smith and David Hume met during Smith's lectures in Edinburgh and became lifelong close friends.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密在格拉斯哥大学师从法兰西斯·哈奇森学习道德哲学，并深受其启发。
description.en: At the University of Glasgow, Adam Smith studied moral philosophy under Francis Hutcheson and was deeply inspired by him.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密撰写并出版了《道德情操论》，该书具体化了他在格拉斯哥的授课内容。
description.en: Adam Smith wrote and published 'The Theory of Moral Sentiments', which elaborated on the content of his lectures in Glasgow.

relationships.target: 国民财富的性质和原因的研究

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密撰写并出版了《国富论》，奠定了古典自由市场经济理论的基础。
description.en: Adam Smith wrote and published 'The Wealth of Nations', which laid the foundation for classical free-market economic theory.

relationships.source: 国民财富的性质和原因的研究

description.zh-cn: 《国富论》成为针对重商主义最经典的反驳，推动了自由贸易思想的传播。
description.en: 'The Wealth of Nations' became the most classic refutation of mercantilism, promoting the spread of free trade ideas.

relationships.source: 国民财富的性质和原因的研究

description.zh-cn: 《国富论》否定了重农主义学派对于土地是财富唯一来源的观点，强调劳动的重要性。
description.en: 'The Wealth of Nations' refuted the physiocratic school's view that land is the sole source of wealth, emphasizing the importance of labor instead.

relationships.source: 国民财富的性质和原因的研究

description.zh-cn: 《国富论》的出版被认为是古典经济学的开端，为该学派提供了理论基础。
description.en: The publication of 'The Wealth of Nations' is considered the beginning of classical economics, providing the theoretical foundation for this school of thought.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密接受查理·汤森的聘请，担任其继子亨利·斯科特的私人家教，并陪同其游历欧洲。
description.en: Adam Smith accepted an offer from Charles Townshend to become the private tutor for his stepson, Henry Scott, accompanying him on a tour of Europe.

relationships.source: 第三代巴克卢公爵亨利·斯科特

description.zh-cn: 亨利·斯科特是亚当·斯密在欧陆游历期间的学生。
description.en: Henry Scott was Adam Smith's pupil during his tour of the European continent.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密在欧陆游历期间，于日内瓦见到了他所仰慕的伏尔泰。
description.en: During his tour of Europe, Adam Smith met the much-admired Voltaire in Geneva.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密在巴黎结识了重农主义学派的领导人弗朗索瓦·魁奈，并极为尊重其理论。
description.en: In Paris, Adam Smith met François Quesnay, the leader of the Physiocratic school, and held his theories in high regard.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密出生于苏格兰法夫郡的柯科迪。
description.en: Adam Smith was born in Kirkcaldy, Fife, Scotland.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密在格拉斯哥担任教职期间与约瑟夫·布雷克成为同事并建立了一生的友谊。布雷克是斯密的遗嘱执行人之一。
description.en: Adam Smith became a colleague and lifelong friend of Joseph Black while teaching in Glasgow. Black was one of the executors of Smith's will.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密与詹姆斯·赫顿是好友，共同创立了牡蛎俱乐部，赫顿也是斯密的遗嘱执行人之一。
description.en: Adam Smith and James Hutton were friends who co-founded the Oyster Club. Hutton was also one of the executors of Smith's will.

description.zh-cn: 大卫·休谟在临终前请求亚当·斯密在他身后出版《自然宗教对话录》，但斯密出于对自身和休谟声誉的担忧而拒绝了这一请求。
description.en: Before his death, David Hume asked Adam Smith to publish 'Dialogues Concerning Natural Religion' posthumously, but Smith refused due to concerns for his own and Hume's reputation.

description.zh-cn: 亚当·斯密因发表悼念并赞扬大卫·休谟的《致斯特拉汉的信》，而遭受了巨大的争议和舆论攻击，他自称这篇悼词为他带来的辱骂比《国富论》还要猛烈十倍。
description.en: By publishing the 'Letter to William Strahan', which eulogized and praised David Hume, Adam Smith faced immense controversy and public attacks. He claimed this eulogy brought him ten times more abuse than his entire 'Wealth of Nations'.
